page.title: 03Biographies from Pennington
page.content: George Fox lived from 1642 to 1691.He started the society of Friends or Quakerism.He came to Swarthmoor Hall and he married Margaret Fell.He wrote two books about the people he met and his journeys.Fox was a big,tall man with fierce-looking eyes.He was known for his courage and honesty.Because of his beliefs he was sent to prison several times for a total of six years.He began preaching in 1647.He travelled abroad preaching.When he was being tried in Derby he said to the judge:"You will tremble at the word of the Lord."The judge replied:"We will call you a Quaker." William Fleming was born in 1770 and died in 1829.He wrote a diary about the people of Pennington.It was written between the years of 1778 and 1821.He farmed at Rowe Hall.He spent the winter in his house in Ulverston.
